data.title: Document how to write a grammar or theme.
data.body:
I would like to suggest that we add some default syntax/theme scopes to the docs for basic stuff (classes, methods/functions, operators, etc.) which all themes shall support.
- For example Sublime has: https://gist.github.com/alehandrof/5361546

The issue is that every theme and extension maker supports it's own scopes - but with users changing the themes and/or extensions, the highlighters break / get unsupported.

Even with the last VS Update, I got reports that the highlighting is no longer working while the extension itself hadn't any changes published. Later I noticed that long-time supported scopes such as "entity.name.class" suddenly weren't supported anymore by themes such as the high-contrast one.

Also, scopes such as "support.function" work on some themes like MonoKai or Monokai Dimmed but fail to work with others, again like the high-contrast one.

This creates misunderstandings when working in a team with people who use different themes and makes compatibility harder.

I type `test.`, nothing happens so I type `Ctrl-Space` and after 1-2 seconds(!) an empty menu comes up.

Function arguments aren't suggested:

![screen shot 2016-01-15 at 5 13 46 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79215/12369402/60b84a76-bbab-11e5-8993-1363213ebd4c.png)

My `jsconfig.json`:

```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "ES6",
        "module": "commonjs"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules"
    ]
}
```

data.title: NONE of the code features work in ES6 projects for language type: Javascript
Sort extensions by install count rather than alphabetically.
data.body:
It is easy to game the current system for extensions. This PR should solve that by sorting extensions based on install count. 

There was some concern about adding the "install count" filter to the API. Here is the profiling using a python script and [cProfile](https://docs.python.org/2/library/profile.html#module-cProfile). 

| Test Run | No Install Count | Retrieving Install Count |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | 2.212 | 1.792 |
| 2 | 1.792 | 2.193 |
| 3 | 1.805 | 1.798 |
| 4 | 1.755 | 1.856 |
| 5 | 1.708 | 1.874 |
| Mean | 1.854 | 1.903 |

As you can see there is a slight slow down. Seems trivial to me though. 

Feedback on the UI is appreciated. 

You'll notice I made a trade off in the UI to remove "days ago" in favor of install count. I rearranged install count with version. I played around with adding "installs" next to the number, but decided against it only so as not to clutter the UI. 

![screen shot 2016-01-15 at 3 07 30 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/12368171/d5a816da-bb9d-11e5-9d91-b1fb6e3a9798.png)

Here is the old UI for reference. 

![screen shot 2016-01-15 at 3 44 15 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/12368297/e8be0c56-bb9e-11e5-8167-e51351c685b5.png)

data.title: Feature request: Code hinting/Intellisense for custom angularJS modules
data.body:
Would be really lovely if VSC can support hinting and intellisense for custom angular modules created by devs in a project and not just the default angularJS support.

1: Create a new angularJS module e.g services in a separate file eg services.js
2: return to a separate file say controller.js and create a new controller.
3: reference service from controller and as one is typing code hints and intellisense popup showing related function created in service.

Thanks

data.title: Git authentication
data.body:
Trying to publish while the repo url contains username will still ask me for username. 
Leaving empty or filling in the username and password will result in authentication fail by remote server.

Example, 
repo url: https://FilipDz@bitbucket.org/FilipDz/baze.git
username: <empty> or FilipDz
password: ******
output:
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://FilipDz@bitbucket.org/FilipDz/node-baze.git/'

data.title: Typescript type definition files not picked up from scoped npm packages. Cannot handle @ in paths
data.body:
When a scoped npm package is installed, for example, `@MyCompany/utils` it's installed in `node_modules/@MyCompany/utils`.

Since the package's `package.json` contains:

```
"typescript": {
  "definition": "my-typings.d.ts"
}
```

... this means I can add a reference to `my-typings.d.ts` to the file `typings/tsd.d.ts` using the command:

```
tsd link
```

The following will be added to `typings/tsd.d.ts`:

```
/// <reference path="../node_modules/@MyCompany/utils/my-typings.d.ts" />
```

However VSCode 0.10.6 OS X shows a red squiggly line and says it cannot find the file.
If I move `@MyCompany/utils/my-typings.d.ts` to `MyCompany/utils/my-typings.d.ts` and update `typings/tsd.d.ts` to 

```
/// <reference path="../node_modules/MyCompany/utils/my-typings.d.ts" />
```

the squiggly line disappears, and the typings in that file is picked up so the problem seems to be the `@`character in the path.

data.title: Git Commit trying to spawn ssh?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In the Git section, I have my file that I just updated, and now I want to commit locally, I click the little check mark, and I get the little clock icon, and now I'm waiting forever. I check the log and have lots of this: 

git fetch
error: cannot spawn ssh: No such file or directory
fatal: unable to fork
git fetch
error: cannot spawn ssh: No such file or directory
fatal: unable to fork
git fetch
error: cannot spawn ssh: No such file or directory
fatal: unable to fork
git fetch
error: cannot spawn ssh: No such file or directory
fatal: unable to fork
git fetch

Maybe I don't understand the process, but when I want to commit locally, why would it do these other things? And now I'm waiting forever for it to release...restarting the app doesn't help. But it did commit the change locally, without telling me. 

This is on Windows 7...not sure what else might be needed to address this issue.

data.title: Warnings disappear when opening files from the Error and Warnings quick box
data.body:
I have a task defined that uses a problem matcher to create warnings. 

Assume it creates 5 warnings for file A and 2 warnings for file B. The total warning count shown in the status bar is now 7.

Now follow these steps:
- Open `View>Show Errors and Warnings` 
- Navigate to file A (do not fix any warnings)
- Open `View>Show Errors and Warnings` again
- Navigate to file B

At this point the warning count in the status bar drops to 2. This is confusing since without doing  anything the 5 warnings have disappeared. 

The reason is that when I open file A from Errors and Warnings it isn't put into the working files. Then when I open file B, File A is closed and its markers get cleared.

To avoid this confusion I suggest that opening a file from Errors and Warnings puts the file into the 'Working files' section, that is, the file is kept open and the warnings do not disappear.  So the effect would be the same as if I double clicked the file from the explorer.

Assigning to Jo as the owner of diagnostics and the Errors and Warnings quick box. @dbaeumer fyi.

data.title: Completion does not work with instanceof operator (typescript)
data.body:
With a typescript source file, when using the [type guarded type inference](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/What's-new-in-TypeScript#type-guards), the auto completion does not work...

An example :

```
if(myObj instanceof MyClass) {
    myObj.ab// hit Ctrl+Space, the autocompletion will not trigger but should propose members of MyClass
}
```

Thanks !

data.title: Font becomes blurry after a certain amount of tab indentations
data.body:
I saw that there are already a couple of font rendering related issues, so apologies if this issue is already covered by another issue, but I think this may be a special case.

I have installed the [ProggyClean](http://www.proggyfonts.net/download) bitmap font (the TrueType version) and noticed that the font suddenly becomes blurry after 4 tab indentations, but using spaces it looks fine:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10862380/12351756/7a451094-bb80-11e5-8736-be7ff03ebf48.png)

These are my font settings:

```
{
    "editor.fontFamily": "ProggyCleanTT",
    "editor.fontSize": 16,
    "editor.lineHeight": 16
}
```

Other than that I have no special font/editor settings. I'm running Windows 8.1 and latest VS Code.

data.title: Implement a horizontal panel for the workbench
data.body: Adding horizontal panel to the workbench (see #1875).

data.title: Localize Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Today we have the Monaco editor localized. This plan item captures how we get to a localized VS Code. 

We need to localize both the `core` and the `extensions` we bundle.
## Core + Helper Apps

The core includes the main process, renderer, and extension host. All these components use AMD and we will use the same localization approach as is used in the Monaco editor (`nls.localize`).

The core includes some built-in languages like PHP, CSS, JSON. Each of these languages comes with strings that are used as documentation for Intellisense or validation (PHP built-in functions, CSS attribute descriptions, JSON schema descriptions from http://schemastore.org/json/). We will not externalize and translate these strings initially.

Tasks:
- [x] Provide a tslint rule to check for non-externalized strings.  @dbaeumer 
- [x] Externalize the remaining strings. Major areas of the workbench are already localized, but there are gaps. @Microsoft/vscode
- [x] Review the places where we expose exception messages directly to the user (e.g. editor, explorer, git, search) and ensure that a higher-level translatable error message is shown in the UI, which incluldes the raw error as detail in parenthesis. @bpasero 
- [x] Localize the Search App. @dbaeumer 
- [x] Localize the Git App @dbaeumer 
- [x] Plugin Host @dbaeumer 
- [x] Main @dbaeumer 
- [x] Renderer @dbaeumer 
## Extensions

Extensions are implemented using the CommonJS modules and the AMD based externalization used in the Code cannot be use. The goal is to use the same file format for the language bundles used for the Core and extensions.

An extensions has contributes strings in the package.json and from the code.  We need a localization support for both.

Tasks:
- [x] Localization support for the package.json.
- [x] Provide a node localization module that uses the same file format as for the core and that can be used by extensions..
- [x] Provide nls-checking tool to check for non-localized strings for the bundled extensions
- Externalize bundled extensions (with user visible strings)
  - [x] TypeScript
  - [x] JSON
  - :question: others
## Debug Adapters
- [x] Support that messages from the debug adapter can be localized @weinand 
## Development Tasks
- [x] Support pseudo localization for testing.
- [x] Document the localization support so that the community can contribute translations.
- [x] Tools to enable contributions of translations.
- [x] Support install/update localized Code versions.
## Roadmap
- January
  - Core + Apps is localized
  - Demo Code in German (minus extensions)
- February
  - Bundled extensions are localized
  - Bundled debug adapter are localized
  - Demo Code in German with a localized extension

data.title: Debug: viewlet should implement focus() method
data.body: This method is called in various cases, e.g. when triggering the viewlet action from the left activity bar. You should pass on focus to one of your trees in the split views, ideally the one that last had focus.

data.title: Customisable double click-select behaviour
data.body:
Upon double-clicking, people have different expectations across various languages.
The ability to define custom highlighting rules based on the selected text would simultaneously solve a lot of highlighting issues and increase the flexibility of the editor.

My motivation for bringing this up comes from my frustration with variable selection in PHP.
When double-clicking 'foo' in '$foo->bar()' you will end up selecting '$foo-', my preference  would be 'foo'.
I also noticed another issue regarding double clicking white-space where the user would like it to select all connected white-space.
These kinds of rules would be perfectly suited for on the fly user customisation.

data.title: Commands: inconsistent matching
data.body: I still do not like that our camel case matcher kicks in for commands though. So I would expect that `Focus Right` matches on `Focus into Right Hand Editor` as well as `Focus into Next Editor to the Right`.

data.title: Integrate tslint
data.body:
This PR integrates tslint. 

It adds:
- a `tslint.json` file. The rules defined in the tslint.json file are currently minimal. The only rule enabled is the `no-unused-variable`. 
- `gulp tslint` runs tslint across the vscode base.
- a task to run tslint from inside Code.
- the microsoft tslint rule [extensions](https://github.com/Microsoft/tslint-microsoft-contrib). The rules are currently not used, but they will enable us to use rules like `promise-must-complete`.

To get tslint checking as you type you need to install the [vscode-tslint](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items/eg2.tslint).

data.title: php "here doc" not getting highlighted
data.body:
When writing "here document" the string doesn't get highlighted as a string, but instead displays as white text. I am using the "Default Dark" color scheme.

``` php
echo <<<END
This uses the "here document" syntax to output
multiple lines with $variable interpolation. Note
that the here document terminator must appear on a
line with just a semicolon. no extra whitespace!
END;
```
